intro: Sida sinensium, commonly known as Chinese thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its prickly stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Sida sinensium is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
